benefits: Improves posture and balance, strengthens thighs, knees, ankles, and core. Enhances awareness and mental clarity. Increases height in growing children and improves breathing capacity by opening up the chest.
cautions: Avoid practicing this asana if you have low blood pressure, dizziness, or insomnia. People with vertigo should use wall support.
diseases_helped: Flat feet, postural problems, mild sciatica, anxiety, respiratory issues
body_parts_improved: Spine, thighs, knees, ankles, abdomen, arms, lungs

benefits: Aids digestion when practiced after meals. Calms the nervous system, strengthens the lower back and pelvic muscles. Increases blood circulation in the abdominal region and promotes inner peace.
cautions: Avoid this asana if you have severe knee pain, recent foot or ankle surgery, or hernia. Pregnant women should consult a doctor before practicing.
diseases_helped: Acidity, indigestion, gas, constipation, menstrual cramps, sciatica
body_parts_improved: Knees, thighs, ankles, pelvic muscles, digestive organs, spine

benefits: Opens up the hips and groins, stretches the inner thighs, and improves flexibility of the lower body. Stimulates abdominal organs and improves blood flow in the pelvic region. Calms the mind and prepares the body for meditation.
cautions: Avoid if you have serious groin or knee injuries. Use support (cushions) if there’s discomfort.
diseases_helped: Menstrual disorders, urinary tract issues, digestive problems, fatigue
body_parts_improved: Hips, inner thighs, knees, groin, bladder, abdominal organs

benefits: Improves balance and flexibility in the hips, ankles, and groin. Tones the lower abdomen and aids digestion. Helps in opening up the pelvic floor and relieving menstrual discomfort.
cautions: Avoid if you have severe knee or lower back injury. Pregnant women should practice with caution and under supervision.
diseases_helped: Constipation, lower back tension, menstrual pain, hip tightness
body_parts_improved: Hips, ankles, groin, abdomen, pelvic floor, spine

benefits: Stretches the body from head to toe, strengthens the arms, shoulders, and improves posture. Enhances lung capacity and energizes the body. Improves digestion and stimulates the lymphatic system.
cautions: Avoid if you have shoulder injuries or vertigo. Do not strain the neck while lifting arms.
diseases_helped: Poor posture, respiratory issues, fatigue, digestion problems

benefits: Strengthens thighs, calves, and the spine. Tones abdominal muscles and improves balance and endurance. Stimulates the heart and diaphragm and enhances determination.
cautions: Avoid if you have knee injuries, arthritis, or low blood pressure. Practice against a wall for support if needed.
diseases_helped: Arthritis (mild), flat feet, fatigue, weakness in legs

benefits: Stretches and strengthens the legs, hips, groin, hamstrings, and spine. Opens the chest and shoulders, improving overall posture and breathing. Enhances stability, focus, and relieves back pain.
cautions: Avoid if you have migraine, diarrhea, or low blood pressure. Be cautious with neck or back issues — do not turn the head upward.
diseases_helped: Sciatica, anxiety, flat feet, digestion issues
body_parts_improved: Hips, hamstrings, spine, chest, shoulders, legs

benefits: Lengthens the spine, stretches the hamstrings and calves. Improves posture and balance. Energizes the body and helps prepare for deeper forward bends.
cautions: Avoid if you have lower back pain, slipped disc, or recent abdominal surgery. Slightly bend the knees if hamstrings are tight.
diseases_helped: Fatigue, back stiffness, tight hamstrings, mild anxiety

benefits: Improves balance, strengthens legs and spine, and enhances focus and concentration. Encourages grounding and stability both physically and mentally.
cautions: Avoid if you have vertigo, insomnia, or high blood pressure. Use wall support if balance is difficult.
diseases_helped: Postural imbalance, lack of focus, mild leg weakness

benefits: Deeply opens the hips, stretches thighs, groins, and psoas. Releases tension from the lower back and hip joints. Improves posture and calms the nervous system, enhancing emotional release.
cautions: Avoid if you have recent hip surgery, knee injuries, or severe lower back issues. Always use props like cushions if flexibility is limited.
diseases_helped: Sciatica, menstrual cramps, stress, hip tightness
body_parts_improved: Hips, thighs, groin, lower back, pelvis

benefits: Improves flexibility and strength in arms, chest, and lower back. Builds endurance and prepares the body for full Sun Salutation. Enhances coordination and balances energy through all 8 contact points.
cautions: Avoid if you have shoulder, elbow, or spinal injuries. Don’t force your body — maintain even breathing.
diseases_helped: Respiratory weakness, low stamina, sluggish circulation

benefits: Strengthens the spine, tones glutes, opens chest and lungs. Stimulates digestive organs and helps relieve stress. Improves mood, boosts energy, and promotes emotional healing.
cautions: Avoid if pregnant, or with recent abdominal surgery, hernia, or severe back pain. Keep elbows slightly bent for support.
diseases_helped: Asthma, indigestion, mild depression, lower back weakness

benefits: Strengthens the arms, shoulders, wrists, and core. Builds stamina and enhances body alignment. Prepares the body for advanced arm balances and supports a healthy posture.
cautions: Avoid if you have wrist pain, shoulder injuries, or lower back issues. Keep elbows close to your ribs to avoid strain.
diseases_helped: Postural imbalance, weak arms, poor core strength
body_parts_improved: Arms, wrists, shoulders, chest, core, back

benefits: Stretches the entire front of the body, strengthens the back and spine, and opens the chest and shoulders. Stimulates abdominal organs and improves digestion. Relieves fatigue and anxiety.
cautions: Avoid if you have high blood pressure, hernia, or severe spinal problems. Do not practice during pregnancy.
diseases_helped: Constipation, menstrual discomfort, fatigue, mild depression

benefits: Deeply stretches the hamstrings, calves, and hips. Improves core engagement and concentration. Tones the abdominal muscles and stimulates digestion.
cautions: Avoid if you have lower back pain, hamstring injury, or if you're menstruating. Don’t overstretch — keep the lifted leg slightly bent if needed.
diseases_helped: Indigestion, tight hamstrings, fatigue, poor core strength

benefits: Calms the brain, stretches the knees and ankles, and opens the hips. Deepens meditation by creating a strong foundation and promoting inner stillness. Regulates breathing and reduces mental tension.
cautions: Avoid if you have knee, hip, or ankle injuries. Beginners should practice with support and avoid forcing the legs into the position.
diseases_helped: Anxiety, insomnia, high blood pressure, stress-related disorders

benefits: Improves circulation to the brain, builds focus and strength. Enhances balance, strengthens the shoulders, arms, and spine. Reverses the effects of gravity on the organs and calms the nervous system.
cautions: Avoid during menstruation, pregnancy, or if you have high blood pressure, neck issues, or glaucoma. Practice only under supervision if new to inversions.
diseases_helped: Mild depression, poor blood circulation, fatigue, anxiety

benefits: Opens up the chest, lungs, and shoulders. Strengthens the back and improves flexibility of the spine. Stimulates the thyroid and adrenal glands. Uplifts energy and relieves fatigue and anxiety.
cautions: Avoid if you have neck or lower back injuries. Do not strain the neck or over-compress the lumbar spine. Use props if flexibility is limited.
diseases_helped: Respiratory issues, fatigue, menstrual pain, back stiffness

benefits: Improves balance, strengthens legs, and stretches hips and hamstrings. Deepens hip flexibility and stimulates the liver and kidneys. Enhances concentration and calms the nervous system.
cautions: Avoid if you have hip, knee, or lower back injuries. Practice gently and avoid forcing the bind or forward fold.
diseases_helped: Flat feet, stress, sluggish digestion

benefits: Strengthens the spine and hips, increases lung capacity, and deepens meditative focus. Stimulates the abdominal organs and enhances detoxification. Ideal for pranayama and long meditation sessions.
cautions: Avoid if you have knee or hip injuries. Practice only when flexible enough to get into full lotus posture without strain.
diseases_helped: Stress, insomnia, poor digestion, fatigue

benefits: Opens the chest and shoulders, improves hip flexibility, and strengthens the back. Deep heart-opener that enhances posture, self-confidence, and emotional release.
cautions: Avoid if you have back, shoulder, or hip injuries. Use straps or props if full expression isn’t accessible yet.
diseases_helped: Sciatica, emotional stress, poor flexibility

benefits: Deeply stretches hamstrings, groin, and thighs. Builds flexibility, emotional resilience, and symbolizes devotion and courage. Improves pelvic circulation and helps with hip-opening.
cautions: Avoid if you have groin, hamstring, or hip injuries. Use props like blocks and blankets to support full splits safely.
diseases_helped: Tight hamstrings, reproductive tension, sciatica, pelvic stiffness

benefits: Strengthens arms, shoulders, and abdominal muscles. Stimulates digestion, balances hormones, and enhances focus. Builds confidence and mental willpower.
cautions: Avoid if you have wrist, shoulder, or abdominal injuries. Requires good balance and core engagement — use wall support if needed.
diseases_helped: Indigestion, fatigue, weak arms, poor focus
body_parts_improved: Wrists, shoulders, arms, core, digestive system

benefits: Improves blood flow to brain, calms the mind, and strengthens the shoulders and neck. Combines the benefits of inversion with meditative stillness. Boosts thyroid function and emotional stability.
cautions: Avoid if you have neck injuries, high blood pressure, or eye issues. Do not practice during menstruation.
diseases_helped: Insomnia, thyroid imbalance, stress, poor concentration
body_parts_improved: Neck, shoulders, spine, brain, thyroid gland

benefits: Stretches inner thighs, hamstrings, and spine. Calms the brain, improves flexibility, and stimulates abdominal organs. Enhances mental clarity and body awareness.
cautions: Avoid if you have lower back injury or sciatica. Keep spine long and avoid rounding the back.
diseases_helped: Digestive issues, anxiety, fatigue, tight hips
body_parts_improved: Hamstrings, inner thighs, spine, abdomen, groin

benefits: Strengthens the core, legs, and back while improving balance and body control. Opens the chest and shoulders. Builds deep awareness and self-discipline.
cautions: Avoid if you have spinal, wrist, or shoulder injuries. Practice with support or wall if needed.
diseases_helped: Poor core strength, shoulder tension, postural issues

benefits: Powerfully opens the chest, lungs, and shoulders. Strengthens the entire body — arms, legs, back, and core. Energizes the heart and relieves fatigue and mild depression.
cautions: Avoid if you have back injuries, wrist pain, or high blood pressure. Warm-up well before practicing.
